div.div:
Craig - July 5, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 8.8
New update broken
After installing new busy box version 1.202 with this app successfully as soon as i close this app an reopen it I'm back to outdated 1.18.1 busy box version an that's even without rebooting, this only happens with the lastest update with smart and normal install tried both an failed on my gnex with jellybean 4.1.

James - July 1, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 8.4
Responsive Developer
Since this app is basically an installer for the publicly-available BusyBox applets, this review is about the developer and the installer. Application was not installing latest version of the BusyBox applets correctly on my device. I emailed the developer, and got an immediate response, and a workaround in less than an hour. New version correcting the issue was released within 12 hours. Exceptionally responsive, I am impressed!

Derek - June 3, 2012 - Lenovo Indigo
All is not well with Version 8.0
After running, it indicated the previous version was installed in /system/xbin yet prompted to be installed in /system/bin. All hell broke loose after changing this to /system/xbin and selecting install. Long story short....The installation failed, could not su to root anymore and no apps requiring root would work thereafter even though the SuperUser app said it was granting root permissions. Also, lost WiFi and ADB stopped working via the USB cable. Had to restore a CWM backup of /system but did another backup before restoring so as to be able to see what went wrong. Sure enough, there is the V8.0 busybox file in /system/bin after extracting the /system archive from the latest CWM backup. In other words, it tried to install itself in /system/bin anyway and in doing so prevented access to /system/bin thereafter for some strange reason.

div.p: Busybox: the key to open the gates to Android! And with great support! I've installed this on my Rezound, both of my roommates phones (RAZR MAXX and D2G), my buddy's Thunderbolt, and my other buddy's Bionic, and it works like a charm. Don't leave home without it. And if you have issues, email the dev before making terrible comments. He will help!
